New Records: Buddy Hield broke his own record for most made threes in the first five games with a new team in NBA history (23 3-points)
Key Match Events: Buddy Hield finished the game with a team-high 21 points, including a 26-foot buzzer-beater to close the first half
The Dubs took the lead right out of the gate, scoring the first six points of the night and never looked back
Draymond Green scored eight straight points for the Warriors in the second frame, knocking down two 3-pointers during his run
Trayce Jackson-Davis recorded a big rejection
Lindy Waters III recorded a plus-13 plus-minus in his first career start
Post-Match Reflections: Draymond Green finished with a season-high 14 points, connecting on three 3-pointers in the win
Brandin Podziemski finished with a near triple-double, recording 13 points, eight rebounds, and seven assists
